intro: Corynostylis macrobotrys, commonly known as the large-flowered spiny lily, is a striking member of the Iridaceae family native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its tall, branched stems and showy, violet-blue flowers with prominent, spiny bracts. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often surrounded by leaf-like bracts. It thrives in damp, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a notable species in New Zealand's botanical diversity.
